did.unittitle: William Henry Channingto Elizabeth Oakes Smith

scopecontent.p: [Claims that her letter and circular were delayed; believes subscribers will be impossible to find because they are too conservative in spirit; mentions awakened interest from newspapers after her lecture before the Lyceum; encourages her to publish her lectures soon in order to keep public interest focused on her; mentions Margaret Fuller; discusses a letter Smith sent to his cousin, H. Channing, who "would be not a little amused at being thought a friend of 'woman's rights'."]
